object.name: Rightside Down -- Moving Wood Platform (Blank)
object.notes: A moving platform from Rightside Down Galaxy. It has a blank surface.

object.name: Rightside Down -- Moving Wood Platform (Checkered)
object.notes: A moving platform from Rightside Down Galaxy. It has a checker patterned surface.

object.name: Rightside Down -- Intro Planet
object.notes: The decorative building blocks planet that can be seen at the beginning of Rightside Down Galaxy.

object.name: Air Bubble
object.notes: A stationary bubble that replenishes air when collected underwater. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A bubble that restores the player's air when collected underwater.

object.name: Air Bubble Generator
object.notes: A nozzle that periodically generates several air bubbles that replenish the player's air when underwater. A nozzle that periodically generates air bubbles.

field.name: Delay
field.notes: Time between bubble spawns in frames.

field.name: Duration
field.notes: Life duration of a single bubble in frames.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins -- Luma Cage
object.notes: Stationary object that will disappear once its SW_B gets triggered. Plays the "Open" animation and destroys itself after that. Plays a short cutscene using a special camera. The red metal cage from Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Underwater Planet
object.notes: The large planet found in the 2D underwater section from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Sea Mine Plant
object.notes: The large planet found in Cosmic Cove Galaxy's 2D section that features Jammyfish and Sea Mines.

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- Moving Water Cube
object.notes: A cube-shaped body of water from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.name: Collision Movement Area
object.notes: Moves compatible objects inside this area if they are bound to a floor triangle with the collision type AreaMove. Compatible objects are the player itself, BombBird and its bombs, Kuribo, Karon and CocoNut. Moves compatible objects if they are on AreaMove collision triangles.

field.name: Speed
field.notes: Sets the movement speed.

object.name: Arrow Sign
object.notes: A large arrow-shaped sign with a red outline.

object.name: Arrow Switch
object.notes: A rotating switch object that can be activated using Spin Attacks. An arrow-shaped switch that rotates once it gets triggered.

field.name: Rotation Direction
field.values: -1 = 180° to right or left, 0 = 90° to left, 1 = 90° to right, 2 = 180° to left, 3 = 180° to right
field.notes: Specifies the rotation when hit.

field.name: Activation Mode
field.notes: If enabled, it cannot be hit again util the SW_A event deactivates again.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets shadow drop length.

object.name: Blue Space Junk Block
object.notes: Remains at a resting position that can be defined by linking a GeneralPos with the name 合体ブロック故郷点 to it. Once the player gets in its range, it will move to its actual position. This class supports ShapeModelNo models. The timed activation requires additional effect data under the UniqueName "Blur". A square-shaped Space Junk block.

field.name: Activation Range
field.notes: Specifies the activation range to Mario's position. If set to -1, the model's diameter is used instead.

field.name: Activation Time
field.notes: If Obj_arg7 is set, this specifies the timer until the block disappears again.

field.name: Is Timed?
field.notes: If enabled, the block will be activated for a set amount of time only.

This class supports ShapeModelNo models. The timed activation requires additional effect data under the UniqueName "Blur". A long Space Junk block.

field.notes: Specifies the activation range to Mario's position. If set to -1, the model's diameter is used instead.

field.name: Activation Time

field.name: Is Timed?

This class supports ShapeModelNo models. The timed activation requires additional effect data under the UniqueName "Blur". A triangular Space Junk Block.

object.name: Decorative Asteroids (Small)
object.notes: A group of many small asteroids that serve as decoration.

object.name: Toy Time -- Mario/Luigi Planet Parts
object.notes: The lava and swamp platformsand the large brick platform that serve as the basis of the 8-Bit Mario/Luigi planet from Toy Time Galaxy and Mario Squared Galaxy.

object.name: Decorative Asteroids (Medium)
object.notes: A group of many medium-sized asteroids that serve as decoration.

object.name: Comet Observatory -- Gateway Planet
object.notes: The small planet from the Comet Observatory that leads to Gateway Galaxy.

object.name: Comet Observatory -- Library Interior
object.notes: The interior of the Comet Observatory's Library.

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock (Fight)
object.notes: Usually not visible but they get activated by Bowser's attacks. Once it appears, it falls down onto ground. Then, it becomes a yellow orb that can be smashed into Bowser. Depending on the encounter number, it can also emit shockwaves. A yellow orb that appears during the boss fights against Bowser.

field.name: Bowser Encounter Number
field.notes: If greater than 1, the rock will emit a purple quake wave once it lands.

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock (Final Fight)
object.notes: These are usually not visible until Bowser activates them during the final fight. These fly to their actual position and will remain there. The orb can be smashed into Bowser. A yellow orb that appears during the final boss fight against Bowser.

field.name: First Appearance Delay
field.notes: Delay until the rock appears for the first time.

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock (Stage)
object.notes: A rock that emits from the ground and breaks into a yellow orb. It can be smashed into KoopaSeals. A yellow orb that appears before the fights against Bowser.

object.name: Audio Effect Area
object.notes: Sets the audio effect once entered by the player. For example, this can enable echoes. Enables a different audio effect once entered.

field.name: Effect Type
field.values: 0 = Default, 1 = Underground Echo, 2 = Unused, 3 = Unused, 4 = Fleet Glide, 5 = Fleet Glide, 6 = Unused
field.notes: Specifies which effect configuration to use.

field.name: Priority
field.notes: Priority of the audio effect (unrelated to areas).

object.name: Starship Mario -- Rosalina's Comet
object.notes: The large egg-shaped comet that appears during Starship Mario's ending cutscene.

object.name: Mattermouth
object.notes: A skull that moves around freely or on a set path. It "eats" away parts of objects that are compatible with ClipDrawArea. This enemy cannot be defeated in any way. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A gluttonous skull enemy from Haunty Halls Galaxy.

object.name: Haunty Halls -- Small Rotating Carpet Platform
Lava Lair -- Mattermouth Carpet
object.notes: The large carpet from Bowser's Lava Lair that is eaten away by Mattermouths.

object.name: Porcupuffer
object.notes: A blowfish enemy that inflates once Mario gets in its range. It will then home on to Mario and explode after a certain amount of time. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A purple blowfish enemy from Drip Drop Galaxy and Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.name: Blimp Fruit
object.notes: A fruit that, when eaten, transforms Yoshi into Blimp Yoshi. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma to make it swing. Can be temporarily destroyed using Koopa Shells or Ground Pounds. The blue fruit that Yoshi can eat to expand and fly like a balloon.

object.name: Generic Star Ball Opener
object.notes: If Mario rides a Star Ball and touches this object's center, it will pull the Star Ball towards the center. Then, the Star Ball will be cracked open. A metal hole with a blue edge that is used to crack Star Balls in Rolling Greens Galaxy and Rolling Gizmo Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Coaster -- Star Ball Opener
object.notes: If Mario rides a Star Ball and touches this object's center, it will pull the Star Ball towards the center. Then, the Star Ball will be cracked open. The round planet from Rolling Coaster Galaxy that features a hole to crack open the Star Ball.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Star Ball Opener
object.notes: If Mario rides a Star Ball and touches this object's center, it will pull the Star Ball towards the center. Then, the Star Ball will be cracked open. A pink pencil platform from Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy that features a hole to crack open the Star Ball.

object.name: Star Ball Rail
object.notes: An invisible rail for the Star Ball. The Star Ball will automatically start to move along the path once it touches the path's beginning. An invisible path that the Star Ball will move on once touched.

field.name: Acceleration
field.notes: Acceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 1500.

field.name: Deceleration
field.notes: Deceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 995.

object.name: Galaxy Generator -- Cloud Flower Planet
object.notes: The planet from Bowser's Galaxy Generator's section that features Cloud Flowers and Bullet Bills.

object.name: Galaxy Generator -- Rotating Stone Lift
object.notes: A rotating cylinder from Bowser's Galaxy Generator that has some small platforms attached to it. Used in the section that features Cloud Flowers and Bullet Bills.

object.name: Sky Station -- Cylindrical Banzai Bill Planet Door
object.notes: The small door that covers the entrance into the cylindrical planet from Sky Station Galaxy's second Star.

object.name: Sky Station -- Cylindrical Banzai Bill Planet Interior
object.notes: The interior parts of the large cylindrical planet from Sky Station Galaxy's second Star.

object.name: Sky Station -- Rotating Metal Lift
object.notes: A rotating cylinder that has four smaller platforms attached to it. It can be found inside the large cylindrical planet from Sky Station Galaxy's second Star.

object.name: Sky Station -- Cylindrical Banzai Bill Planet Exterior
object.notes: The exterior parts of the large cylindrical planet from Sky Station Galaxy's second Star.

object.name: Space Storm -- Long Cylindrical Satellite Planet
object.notes: The long cylindrical satellite planet from Space Storm Galaxy.

object.name: Space Storm -- Small Moving Platform
object.notes: A small moving platform from Space Storm Galaxy's long cylindrical satellite planet.

object.name: Space Storm -- Rotating Metal Lift
object.notes: The rotating metal lift from Space Storm Galaxy's long cylindrical satellite planet.

object.name: Space Storm Foggy Air
object.notes: Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section. The gray foggy air that surrounds the cylindrical planets in Space Storm Galaxy.

field.name: Range
field.notes: Active distance from player's position.

field.name: Hide during intro
field.notes: The air won't appear during the into if enabled.

field.name: Always active?
field.notes: Always active if enabled.

object.name: Swooper
object.notes: A flying bat enemy. These enemies may be flying around passively, move on a path or hang from ceilings. It will fly towards Mario if he comes in their range. They will fly towards Mario to attack him. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) will freeze Mario if touched, provided that Mario is not using the Ice power-up. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Stomping and most other attacks. It can be stunned by shooting Star Bits at them. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) can be attacked if the player is not using the Ice power-up. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A bat enemy that is mostly found in cave sections.

field.name: Detection Range
field.notes: Range in which it will detect the player. Default is 2000.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: Range in which it will attack the player. Default is Detection Range + 1000.

object.name: Ice Swooper
object.notes: A flying bat enemy. These enemies may be flying around passively, move on a path or hang from ceilings. It will fly towards Mario if he comes in their range. They will fly towards Mario to attack him. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) will freeze Mario if touched, provided that Mario is not using the Ice power-up. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Stomping and most other attacks. It can be stunned by shooting Star Bits at them. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) can be attacked if the player is not using the Ice power-up. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma in SMG2. An icy Swooper that can freeze the player upon contact. Can be defeated using Ice Mario's attacks or the Invincibility power-up.

field.name: Detection Range
field.notes: Range in which it will detect the player. Default is 2000.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: Range in which it will attack the player. Default is Detection Range + 1000.

object.name: Whomp
object.notes: A stone block enemy that moves on a fixed path. Once it sees Mario, it will move towards him to fall down on him. Once it lies on the ground, the weak point on its back can be Ground Pounded. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma. It will spawn 7 Star Bits if defeated. A large rectangular stone block enemy that can attack by falling onto the player.

field.name: Movement Speed
field.notes: Defines the movement speed, multiplied by 1000. Default is 600.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: The range in which it will fall down onto the ground after detecting Mario.

field.name: Spawn no Star Bits?
field.notes: If enabled, it won't spawn any Star Bits after being defeated.

object.name: Whomp King
object.notes: A large stone block boss. It can summon Whimps that will try to attack Mario like Whomps do. The boss itself can defeat those smaller blocks by crushing them. Like its smaller counterparts, this boss will try to fall onto Mario to attack him. It can also attack using shockwaves that appear when he jumps. When he's lying on ground, Mario can Ground Pound the weak spot on its back to damage it. After hitting the boss three times, he will be defeated. It always spawns a Power Star. It uses two GeneralPos. バッタンキング基準位置 is used as his position after the battle. マリオ位置 is used to position Mario after the battle. Several messages are also required. BattanKing000 specifies the introduction text. BattanKing001 specifies the text after defeating him. Lastly, the actual cutscenes have to be specified as well: バッタンキング登場 for the opening and バッタンキングダウン for the outro. The large stone block boss from Throwback Galaxy.

field.name: Camera Register Starting Index
field.notes: Specifies the starting index of the camera vector register. Occupies two cameras.

object.name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Whomp Section Parts
object.notes: Parts of the Whomp section and the last 2D interior section from Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Decorative Asteroid Belt
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A decorative asteroid belt that can be seen in the background of Battle Belt Galaxy.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Mini Goomba Planet
object.notes: The starting planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features a single Mini Goomba.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Swaphopper Planet
object.notes: The interior section from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Swaphoppers.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Swaphopper Planet Blockade
object.notes: A small blockade that covers the exit from Battle Belt Galaxy's Swaphopper planet.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Li'l Brr Planet
object.notes: The ice planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Li'l Brrs.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Jack O'Goomba Planet
object.notes: The pumpkin planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Jack O'Goombas.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Crabber Planet
object.notes: The sand planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Crabbers.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Li'l Cinder Planet
object.notes: The lava planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Li'l Cinders.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Undergrunt Planet
object.notes: The grassy planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features two Undergrunts.

object.name: Fearsome Fleet -- Decorative Wormhole
object.notes: A decorative wormhole that can be seen in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Land Urchin Planet
object.notes: The rocky planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Land Urchins.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Silver Chomp Planet
object.notes: The large metal planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that feautures several Silver Chomps.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Water Boo Planet
object.notes: The underwater section planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Water Boos.

object.name: Bee Eater
object.notes: A stretchy plant with spikes that will lunge onto Mario to damage him. Cannot be defeated, however, they can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit at them. A green plant with red spikes that will try to lunge at Mario to damage him.

object.name: Rotating Flower Platform
object.notes: A rotating platform that can be stood on using the Bee power-up. If the player does not have any of these two power-ups and touches the platform, it will temporarily disappear. A rotating flower platform that can be stood on using the Bee and Cloud power-ups.

field.name: Rotation Speed
field.notes: Sets the rotation's speed.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets the shadow drop length.

object.name: Red Honeybloom Berry
object.notes: A bouncy berry that can be bounced off by Bee Mario. If touched by Mario while he does not have the Bee power-up, it will pop and reappear after about three seconds. One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.

object.name: Pink Honeybloom Berry
object.notes: A bouncy berry that can be bounced off by Bee Mario. If touched by Mario while he does not have the Bee power-up, it will pop and reappear after about three seconds. One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.

object.name: Purple Honeybloom Berry
object.notes: A bouncy berry that can be bounced off by Bee Mario. If touched by Mario while he does not have the Bee power-up, it will pop and reappear after about three seconds. One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.

object.name: Yellow Honeybloom Berry
object.notes: A bouncy berry that can be bounced off by Bee Mario. If touched by Mario while he does not have the Bee power-up, it will pop and reappear after about three seconds. One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.

object.name: Faster Bee Flight Area
object.notes: If the player is using the Bee power-up and is inside this area, it will make them fly a longer distance than usual. Makes Bee Mario fly a longer distance than usual if the player is inside this area.

object.name: Topmini
object.notes: A small robot enemy that will make Mario spin around if touched. However, it can be defeated using Spin Attacks. If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It can be defeated by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A small yellow robot enemy that is always spinning.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Topmini Spawner
object.notes: A black hole that periodically spawns more Topman enemies. It will only generate one enemy at a time but it will ensure that the provided number of enemies will be spawned. Defeated enemies will respawn after a while. "BegomanLauncher" generates Spring Topmen, "BegomanBabyLauncher" generates Topmini and "TogeBegomanLauncher" generates Spike Topmen. A black hole that spawns Topmini. Defeated Topmini will respawn after some time.

field.name: Activation Delay
field.notes: The delay until the first spawn occurs.

field.name: Number of Topman
field.notes: Defines the number of Topman to be spawned. Default is 1.

object.name: Spring Topman Spawner
object.notes: A black hole that periodically spawns more Topman enemies. It will only generate one enemy at a time but it will ensure that the provided number of enemies will be spawned. Defeated enemies will respawn after a while. "BegomanLauncher" generates Spring Topmen, "BegomanBabyLauncher" generates Topmini and "TogeBegomanLauncher" generates Spike Topmen. A black hole that spawns Spring Topman. Defeated Spring Topman will respawn after some time.

field.name: Activation Delay
field.notes: The delay until the first spawn occurs.

field.name: Number of Topman
field.notes: Defines the number of Topman to be spawned. Default is 1.

object.name: Spiky Topman
object.notes: A rotating robot enemy that will make Mario spin around if touched. If Mario touches its spiky head, he will take damage. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. A red spiky robot enemy that is always spinning.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Spring Topman
object.notes: A rotating robot enemy that features a spring head which Mario can bounce off. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. If the object is called "BegomanSpringHide", it will remain in the ground until Mario gets in its range. This variant will also spawn a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack. There can only be one Topmini at a time. A yellow robot enemy whose head can be bounced off.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Passive Spring Topman
object.notes: A rotating robot enemy that features a spring head which Mario can bounce off. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. If the object is called "BegomanSpringHide", it will remain in the ground until Mario gets in its range. This variant will also spawn a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack. There can only be one Topmini at a time. A variant of a Spring Topman that resides in the ground and jumps out once the player gets near. It emits a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Gobblegut
object.notes: A long dragon boss. It features six weak spots that have to be popped using the player's attacks. It always spawns a Power Star. It uses a GeneralPos with the name プレイヤーデモ位置（ベリードラゴン戦） to position the player during the intro. If it's part of a cutscene, it also creates cutscene objects for KoopaJr and KoopaJrPod. See "BellyDragonLv1Zone" for a better look inside the cutscene. The dragon boss from Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flottila.

object.name: Fiery Flotilla -- Gobblegut Planet
object.notes: The planet from Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla where Gobblegut is fought.

object.name: Fiery Gobblegut
object.notes: A long dragon boss. It features six weak spots that have to be popped using the player's attacks. It always spawns a Power Star. It uses a GeneralPos with the name プレイヤーデモ位置（ベリードラゴン戦） to position the player during the intro. If it's part of a cutscene, it also creates cutscene objects for KoopaJr and KoopaJrPod. See "BellyDragonLv1Zone" for a better look inside the cutscene. A fiery version of Gobblegut that appears in Battle Belt Galaxy.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Fiery Gobblegut Planet
object.notes: The rocky planet from Battle Belt Galaxy where Fiery Gobblegut is fought.

object.name: Boo Moon -- Folding Swamp Planet
object.notes: A special planet that can fold two times. Each state also has a separate collision mesh that gets loaded in. Usually, the planet will be in its unfolded state. SW_A and SW_B are used to fold it. The folding swamp planet from Boo Moon Galaxy.

object.name: Boo Moon -- Folding Swamp Starting Platform
object.notes: The starting platform from Boo Moon Galaxy's folding swamp planet.

object.name: Boo Moon -- Folding Swamp Midway Platform
object.notes: The second platform from Boo Moon Galaxy's folding swamp planet.

object.name: Boo Moon -- Folding Swamp Curved Platform
object.notes: The curved platform from Boo Moon Galaxy's folding swamp planet.

object.name: Rainbow Star
object.notes: An item that grants Mario the Invincibility power-up when collected. A collectable power-up that transforms Mario into Rainbow Mario.

field.name: Appearance Type
field.values: -1 = Invisible, 1 = On ground after 1 second, 2 = Thrown out, 3 = Thrown out from ? Block, 4 = On ground immediately (SMG2 only)
field.notes: Specifies how the item appears after appearing.

field.name: Clipping Type
field.values: -1 = none, 1 = spherical
field.notes: Specifies the clipping type.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets the shadow drop length. Default 2000.

object.notes: An item that increases the player's health to 6 when collected. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A collectable mushroom that increases the player's health to 6.

field.notes: Specifies the clipping type.

object.notes: An item that grants the player an extra life when collected. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A collectable mushroom that gives an extra life.

field.name: Appearance Type
field.values: -1 = Invisible, 1 = On ground after 1 second, 2 = Thrown out, 3 = Thrown out from ? Block, 4 = On ground immediately (SMG2 only)
field.notes: Specifies how the item appears after appearing.

field.name: Clipping Type
field.values: -1 = none, 1 = spherical
field.notes: Specifies the clipping type.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets the shadow drop length.

object.notes: The large cloudy air that surrounds the Starshroom and Glamdozer planet.

object.name: Hungry Luma Air
object.notes: Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section. The pink atmosphere that surrounds the planets created after feeding a Hungry Luma.

field.name: Hide during intro
field.notes: The air won't appear during the into if enabled.

object.notes: The starry sky model from Chompworks Galaxy, Fleet Glide Galaxy and Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn Sky
object.notes: The sky model from Shiverburn Galaxy that features the infamous alien creatures.

object.name: Slimy Spring Sky
object.notes: The sunset sky model from Slimy Spring Galaxy.

object.name: Fiery Flotilla Sky
object.notes: The sky model from Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla and Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Haunty Halls Sky
object.notes: The sky model from Haunty Halls Galaxy which features a large moon.

object.name: Slipsand Nighttime Sky
object.notes: The nighttime sky model from Slipsand Galaxy that features several large towers.

object.name: Slipsand Daytime Sky
object.notes: The daytime sky model from Slipsand Galaxy and Clockwork Ruins Galaxy that features several large towers.

object.name: Fluffy Bluff Sky
object.notes: The cloudy sky model from Fluffy Bluff Galaxy and Starshine Beach Galaxy.

object.name: Rightside Down Sky
object.notes: The cloudy sky model from Rightside Down Galaxy and the game's Title Screen.

object.name: Music Change Area
object.notes: Changes the background music using the stage's music information in StageBgmInfo. Supports several different changing modes. Changes the stage's background music in various different ways if entered.

field.name: Change Type
field.values: 0 = Change Song, 1 = Fade-out and Change Song, 2 = Change State
field.notes: The music change type.

field.name: Argument 1
field.notes: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 0. ChangeBgmState index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 2. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 1.

field.name: Argument 2
field.notes: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 1. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 2.

object.name: Music Volume Area
object.notes: When Mario enters this area, the music's volume will be changed. The volume resets if the player leaves the area again. Changes the background music's volume if entered.

field.name: Fade Time
field.notes: The music's fade time in frames. Default is 90.

field.name: Volume
field.notes: The music's volume multiplied by 100.

object.name: Big Amp
object.notes: A large electric ball enemy that causes electrical damage. It can only be defeated using the Invincibility power-up. They will move on a path or in a circular motion if no path was assigned. When it attacks something, for example the player, it will pause for a short amount of time. An electric ball-shaped enemy that moves on a set path.

field.name: Movement Speed
field.notes: Sets the movement speed.

field.name: Shadow Type
field.values: -1 = Validate shadows, 1 = Invalidate shadows
field.notes: Sets the shadow type.

object.name: Ending Credits -- Cake
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). The big cake that can be seen during the game's ending credits.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

field.notes: Defines the wind gust's length. Default is 4000.

field.name: Speed
field.notes: The player's movement speed, multiplied by 100. Default is 100.

object.notes: A fan object that creates a gust of wind that can push Boo Mario and Blimp Yoshi. If this is placed in "TeresaMario2DGalaxy", it will use a slightly different sound effect. A large fan that creates a gust that can push Bubbles and Boo Mario.

field.name: Wind Length
field.notes: Defines the wind gust's length. Default is 4000.

field.notes: The player's movement speed, multiplied by 100. Default is 100.

object.name: Amp
object.notes: A small electric ball enemy that causes electrical damage. It can only be defeated using the Invincibility power-up. They will move on a path or in a circular motion if no path was assigned. When it attacks something, for example the player, it will pause for a short amount of time. field.name: Movement Speed

field.name: Side Type
field.values: -1 = Side is path direction, 1 = Opposite of path direction

field.notes: Specifies the gravity calculation type.

object.name: Black Hole (Spherical Attraction)
object.notes: A black hole that sucks in Mario and some compatible objects if they enter a black hole's range. This will kill them immediately. BlackHole objects use a spherical range whereas BlackHoleCube objects use a box-shaped range. The object's scale settings are used to specify the affection area whereas the size of the model can be changed using Obj_arg0. A Black Hole that sucks in the player or defeats some enemies in its range. This one has a spherical attraction range.

field.name: Model Scale
field.notes: Scales the black hole model. Does not change the object's affection area. Default is 1000.

object.name: Black Hole (Cubic Attraction)
object.notes: A black hole that sucks in Mario and some compatible objects if they enter a black hole's range. This will kill them immediately. BlackHole objects use a spherical range whereas BlackHoleCube objects use a box-shaped range. The object's scale settings are used to specify the affection area whereas the size of the model can be changed using Obj_arg0. A Black Hole that sucks in the player or defeats some enemies in its range. This one has a box-shaped attraction range.

field.name: Model Scale
field.notes: Scales the black hole model. Does not change the object's affection area. Default is 1000.

object.name: Bloom Effect Area
object.notes: An area that applies bloom effects to compatible objects inside it. For this, the object needs requires a Bloom.arc model file. However, not all objects support this natively. An area that enables model bloom.

field.name: Intensity
field.notes: Strength of the bloom effect. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 128.

field.name: Threshold
field.notes: Brightness filter level. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 255.

field.name: Intensity 1
field.notes: Primary intensity argument.

field.name: Intensity 2
field.notes: Secondary intensity argument.

object.name: "BloomFlower"
object.notes: An unused class that does not work properly due to a programming error. Normally, it is meant to grow if it's in Bulb Yoshi's light range. This would make a Star Bit appear as well. However, the developers messed up a nerve check, so this effect is never triggered. If it's outside Bulb Yoshi's light, however, it will wither again. Model files have been removed. Therefore, the object is useless.

object.name: Honeybloom Sky
object.notes: The sky model used in Honeybloom Galaxy.

object.name: Pull Star Planet
object.notes: Planet-like objects that feature a large Pull Star inside them. The player can use the pointer on the Pull Star to make it attract Mario. UFOBlueStarCupsule is hardcoded to use a lower target radius. A transparent planet with a Pull Star inside; used in Space Junk Galaxy, Ghostly Galaxy and Space Storm Galaxy.

object.name: Pull Star Explanation Area
object.notes: If Mario stands inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to use Pull Stars. An area that, if entered, notifies the player how to use Pull Stars.

field.name: Explosion Delay

field.name: Unknown 1
field.notes: Default 500.0f

Can be defeated using most of the player's attacks. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A fat bird that drops bombs; used in Dusty Dune Galaxy and Slipsand Galaxy.

field.name: Flies Higher?
field.notes: If enabled, it will fly far above the actual path. Also disables clipping.

field.name: Unknown 1
field.notes: Default 500.0f

If the player swings it around and does not get rid of it after some time, it will blink red and explode. A black boo that explodes when it hits something; used in Ghostly Galaxy.

field.name: Respawns?

object.name: Boomerang Bro
object.notes: A Koopa Troopa that throws boomerangs to attack the player. These boomerangs can be destroyed by the player's attacks or eaten by Yoshi to throw them at other objects. Ground Pounding it will defeat it immediately. Other attacks usually stun it first which gives Mario the advantage to attack it. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma as well. A blue Koopa that throws boomerangs.

field.name: Starting Delay
field.notes: The delay until it starts jumping around.

field.name: Item Type
field.values: -1 = Spawn any items, 0 = Don't spawn any items
field.notes: Specifies how items should be spawned.

field.notes: If enabled, it will be attached to the collision below.

object.name: Warp Pipe
object.notes: A Warp Pipe that can transport the player to another Warp Pipe instance. However, it also supports various other modes and functions unrelated to transportation. Warp Pipes that are placed in WhiteSnowGalaxy have a hardcoded clipping range of 1000. The iconic pipe used to warp Mario from one place to another.

field.name: Exit Force (Forwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario forwards when exiting the pipe. Default 5.

field.name: Exit Force (Upwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario upwards when exiting the pipe. Default 25.

field.name: Mode
field.values: -1 = Entrance and exit, 1 = Exit only, 2 = Hidden until first exited, 3 = Eject without warping, 4 = Eject without warping (spawns Coins), 5 = Eject without warping (spawns Star Bits), 6 = Hide when exited
field.notes: The pipe's behavior after being entered.

field.name: Connection ID
field.notes: Set two pipes to have the same number to link them together.

field.name: Music Change
field.notes: Index of the music to change to once the pipe is left.

field.name: Music State
field.notes: The state of the music that plays after exiting the pipe.

field.name: Ignore Gravity
field.notes: If enabled, the rotation of the pipe will not be affected by gravity.

field.name: Color Frame
field.values: -1 = Green, 1 = Orange
field.notes: The animation frame to use as the pipe's color.

object.name: Underwater Warp Pipe
object.notes: A Warp Pipe that can transport the player to another Warp Pipe instance. However, it also supports various other modes and functions unrelated to transportation. Warp Pipes that are placed in WhiteSnowGalaxy have a hardcoded clipping range of 1000. A Warp Pipe with a vortex that sucks in Mario if he is nearby.

field.name: Exit Force (Forwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario forwards when exiting the pipe. Default 5.

field.name: Exit Force (Upwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario upwards when exiting the pipe. Default 25.

field.name: Mode
field.values: -1 = Entrance and exit, 1 = Exit only, 2 = Hidden until first exited, 3 = Eject without warping, 4 = Eject without warping (spawns Coins), 5 = Eject without warping (spawns Star Bits), 6 = Hide when exited
field.notes: The pipe's behavior after being entered.

field.name: Connection ID
field.notes: Set two pipes to have the same number to link them together.

field.name: Music Change
field.notes: Index of the music to change to once the pipe is left.

field.name: Music State
field.notes: The state of the music that plays after exiting the pipe.

field.name: Ignore Gravity
field.notes: If enabled, the rotation of the pipe will not be affected by gravity.

field.name: Color Frame
field.values: -1 = Green, 1 = Orange
field.notes: The animation frame to use as the pipe's color.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: No Co-Star Pointer Area
object.notes: An area where the function of the Co-Star pointer are disabled.

object.name: Rock Mushroom Boost Area
object.notes: An area that gives the player a speed boost when entered using the Rock Mushroom.

object.name: Large Waterfall Splash Effect
object.notes: A large waterfall splash effect. Used in Honeyhive Galaxy, Gold Leaf Galaxy and Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.name: Small Waterfall Splash Effect
object.notes: An alternate version of a small waterfall effect.

object.name: Small Water Fountain
object.notes: A water fountain effect from Gusty Garden Galaxy. Flings Mario upwards if he stands on it.

object.name: Large Water Fountain
object.notes: A large water fountain from Gold Leaf Galaxy, Fluffy Bluff Galaxy and other stages.

object.name: Shiverburn -- Frozen Volcano
object.notes: The frozen volcano used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn -- Flaming Volcano
object.notes: The flaming volcano used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Generic Galaxy Sky
object.notes: A generic sky model used in several galaxies, including Buoy Base Galaxy and Flip-Swap Galaxy.

object.name: Large Grinder
object.notes: A buzz-saw that moves forward when activated, cutting through objects in its path.

object.name: Puzzle Plank -- Large Brown Semi-Circle Piece of Wood
object.notes: A semi-circular brown piece of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank -- Large Green Semi-Circle Piece of Wood
object.notes: A semi-circular green piece of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.notes: A semi-circular brown piece of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank -- Small Green Semi-Circle Piece of Wood

object.notes: A green piece of wood with holes used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.notes: A short piece of dark wood; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy as the base for the Ground Pound Switch.

object.name: Small Grinder
object.notes: A small buzz-saw that moves forward when activated, cutting through objects in its path.

object.name: Pull Star
object.notes: A small blue Pull Star that can pull Mario towards it.

object.name: Star Ball Respawn Position
object.notes: Can be used to define a Star Ball's respawn position after collecting a Checkpoint Flag.

object.name: Blooper
object.notes: A squid-like enemy usually used underwater.

object.name: Ghost Luigi
object.notes: A ghost version of Luigi that guides the player through a level.

object.name: Haunty Halls -- Boo Corridor Platforms
object.notes: The solid platforms used at the start of the second planet in the second mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

object.name: Haunty Halls -- Boo Corridor Platform
object.notes: A moving platform used on the second planet of the second mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

object.name: Haunty Halls -- Boo Corridor Rug
object.notes: The rugs used on the second planet of the second mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

object.name: Boo Moon -- Maze Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Boo Moon Galaxy.

object.name: Boo Moon -- Maze Darkness Mask
object.notes: The darkness effect mask used on the maze planet of Boo Moon Galaxy.

object.name: Boo Moon -- Maze Door (Left Piece)
object.notes: A large door used on the maze planet of Boo Moon Galaxy.

object.name: Boo Moon -- Maze Door (Right Piece)
object.notes: A large door used on the maze planet of Boo Moon Galaxy.

object.name: Boo Moon -- Maze Planet Blockade
object.notes: A wall used to block access to the Warp Pipe on the maze planet of Boo Moon Galaxy.

object.name: Boo Moon -- Mansion Planet
object.notes: The large mansion planet used in the second mission of Boo Moon Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins -- Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins -- Staircase Gear
object.notes: A gear with opposite staircases used on the starting planet of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins -- L-Blocks Gear
object.notes: A gear with opposite L-shaped blocks used on the starting planet of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins -- Cross Gear
object.notes: A gear with a "cross"-like design of blocks used on the starting planet of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins -- Launch Star Gear
object.notes: A gear used to reach the Launch Star on the starting planet of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Haunty Halls -- Starting Planet Rotating Carpet
object.notes: A rotating circular-shaped carpet used on the starting planet of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

object.name: Haunty Halls -- Starting Planet
object.notes: The solid platforms used on the starting planet of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

object.name: Haunty Halls -- Starting Planet Stationary Carpet
object.notes: An extra carpet with holes used on the starting planet during the second mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

object.name: Glaring Light Area
object.notes: A shining light area that kills Boos when they enter it.

object.name: Fluzzard
object.notes: The colorful bird used for the Gliding minigames in Wild Glide Galaxy and Fleet Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Fluzzard NPC
object.notes: The NPC version of the colorful bird used in Wild Glide Galaxy and Fleet Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Balloon
object.notes: A balloon that gives Star Bits when popped.

object.name: Cannonballs Undergrunt Gunner [Duplicate]
object.notes: An unused duplicate of GliderShooter, which is an Undergrunt Gunner that shoots cannonballs.

object.name: Fleet Glide -- Long Pillar
object.notes: A long pillar that becomes transparent; used in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Fleet Glide -- Short Pillar
object.notes: A short pillar that becomes transparent; used in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Wild Glide -- Canyon Cliffs Planet
object.notes: The canyon cliffs section used near the start of Wild Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Comet Medal Cage
object.notes: A locked cage used to hold the Comet Medal in gliding levels.

object.name: Fleet Glide -- Central Pistons Planet
object.notes: The center of the large battlestation planet used in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Fleet Glide -- Thwomp Tunnel Planet
object.notes: The long tunnel where Thwomps are found in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Fleet Glide -- Lower Battleship Planet
object.notes: The battleship planet parts used in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Fleet Glide -- Collapsing Pillars Planet
object.notes: The section with the collapsing pillars used in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Fleet Glide -- Large Collapsing Pillar
object.notes: A large collapsing pillar used in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Wild Glide -- Forest Cliffs Planet
object.notes: The forest cliffs section used in Wild Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Wild Glide -- Waterfalls Planet
object.notes: The section featuring three tunnels and waterfalls used in Wild Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Fleet Glide -- Hole Tunnel Planet
object.notes: The tunnel with holes used near the start of Fleet Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Wild Glide -- Rainbow Forest Planet
object.notes: The section with trees and a rainbow used in Wild Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Cannonballs Undergrunt Gunner
object.notes: An Undergrunt Gunner that shoots cannonballs; used in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Wild Glide -- Starting Planet
object.notes: The wooden platform and the section used at the start of Wild Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Wild Glide -- Palm Tree
object.notes: A decorative palm tree used in Wild Glide Galaxy that swings if the Fluzzard bonks against it.

object.name: Wild Glide -- Cave Tunnels Planet
object.notes: The triple cave tunnel planet used near the end of Wild Glide Galaxy.

object.name: Barrel Gravity
object.notes: A gravity area that revolves around a barrel-shaped planet.

object.name: Cone Gravity
object.notes: A gravity area for a cone-shaped planet.

object.name: Cube Gravity
object.notes: A gravity area for a cube-shaped planet that allows movement on all six faces.

object.name: Disk Gravity
object.notes: A gravity area for a disk-shaped planet.

object.name: Torus Gravity
object.notes: A gravity area for a torus-shaped planet.

object.name: Planar Gravity (Spherical Range)
object.notes: A gravity area that attracts objects parallel to the plane. This one has a spherical range.

object.name: Planar Gravity (Box Range)
object.notes: A gravity area that attracts objects parallel to the plane. This one has a box range.

object.name: Planar Gravity (Cylindrical Range)
object.notes: A gravity area that attracts objects parallel to the plane. This one has a cylindrical range.

object.name: Spherical Gravity
object.notes: A gravity area that attracts objects towards its origin.

object.name: Cylindrical Gravity
object.notes: A gravity area that pulls objects towards the lateral surface of the cylinder.

object.name: Wire Gravity
object.notes: A gravity area that uses a path to define several points of gravity.

object.name: Chompworks -- Gold Chomp Planet
object.notes: The planet with the Gold Chomps used at the end of the first mission of Chompworks Galaxy.

object.name: Yoshi-Star Sky
object.notes: The sky model used in Yoshi-Star Galaxy and Cloudy Court Galaxy.

object.name: Rhomp
object.notes: A cylindrical-shaped rolling stone obstacle used in Slipsand Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins -- Thick Rolling Wheel
object.notes: A thick rolling wheel used on the ending planet of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins -- Thin Rolling Wheel
object.notes: A thin rolling wheel used on the ending planet of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Rhomp (Set of Two)
object.notes: A set of two Rhomps attached to each other; used in Slipsand Galaxy.

object.name: Slipsand -- Pyramid Slide Planet
object.notes: The large pyramid planet and slide used in the first mission of Slipsand Galaxy.

object.name: Boulder Bowl -- Destroyable Fence
object.notes: A wooden fence that can be broken using the Rock power-up; used in Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Metal Capsule Cage
object.notes: A glass cage with a metal frame that can only be opened via a switch. Used in Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Decorative Rock Boost Ramp
object.notes: A decorative ramp used in sections where the Rock power-up's rolling speed is increased. The actual boost is done by ForceDashCube.

object.name: Melty Monster -- Rock Mushroom Route (Section A)
object.notes: The first section of the Rock Mushroom route used in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Melty Monster -- Rock Mushroom Route (Section B)
object.notes: The last section of the Rock Mushroom route used in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Melty Monster -- Starting Planet Ramp
object.notes: A purple extension for the starting planet used in the second mission of Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Bowling Challenge -- Pair of Platforms
object.notes: A pair of platforms used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Bowling Challenge -- Starting Platform
object.notes: The starting platform used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Bowling Challenge -- Goal Platform
object.notes: The goal ring platform used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Bowling Challenge -- Flat Blue Platform
object.notes: A flat blue platform used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Bowling Challenge -- Blue Platform with Gap
object.notes: A flat blue platform with a gap used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Bowling Challenge -- Blue Moving Platform
object.notes: A flat blue moving platform used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Bowling Challenge -- Blue Rotating Platform
object.notes: A rotating blue platform used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Boulder Bowl -- Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Boulder Bowl -- Mud Planet
object.notes: The mud planet with boulders used in Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Boulder Bowl -- Octoomba Planet
object.notes: The planet where several Octoombas are fought; used in Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Grand Star
object.notes: The Grand Star that is collected at the end of a major boss level.

object.name: Grand Star Return Path
object.notes: A controller used to specify the cutscene and path for when the player returns to the HUB after collecting a Grand Star.

object.name: Swaphopper
object.notes: A blue bug-like enemy with a spike that hops around; intended to be used in 2D sections.

object.name: Upside Dizzy -- Gravity-Changing Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the end of Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Gravity Direction Arrow
object.notes: An arrow used to display the direction of Mario's gravity.

object.name: Gravity Music Controller
object.notes: A controller used to change the state of the background music depending on the player's gravity direction.

object.name: Falling Wooden Crate
object.notes: A large wooden crate with a frame that can be destroyed with a fire ball; used in Rightside Down Galaxy. Always falls down if nothing is below it.

object.name: Falling Snow Block
object.notes: A snow block that can be destroyed with fire balls; used in Freezy Flake Galaxy. Always falls down if nothing is below it.

object.name: Upside Dizzy -- Platform with Short Gravity Panel
object.notes: A platform with a short gravity display panel; used in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Upside Dizzy -- First Planet (Section A)
object.notes: The first section of the first planet used in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Upside Dizzy -- Platform with Short Gravity Panel (Darker)
object.notes: A platform with a short gravity display panel; used in Upside Dizzy Galaxy. This one is slightly darker than GravityFollowLift.

object.name: Upside Dizzy -- Thick Platform with Gravity Panel
object.notes: A thick platform with a gravity display panel; used in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Upside Dizzy -- Platform with Long Gravity Panel
object.notes: A platform with a long gravity display panel; used in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Upside Dizzy -- Moving Gravity Panel
object.notes: A moving gravity display wall used on the first planet of Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Upside Dizzy -- Moving Gravity Panels Planet
object.notes: The second section of the first planet used in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Gravity Light Beam
object.notes: A beam of light used to transport Mario from one planet to another; used in Bowser galaxies.

object.name: Upside Dizzy -- Gravity-Changing Planet Display Wall
object.notes: The gravity display panel used in the ending section of Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Green Star
object.notes: A green Power Star with different twinkling sound effects.

object.name: Multi Switch Controller
object.notes: A controller that activates something if a series of switches are activated.

object.name: Honeyhive Sky
object.notes: The sky model used in Honeyhive Galaxy, Gold Leaf Galaxy, Sky Station Galaxy and Mario Squared Galaxy.

object.name: Hammer Bro
object.notes: A Koopa Troopa variant that throws hammers at the player.

object.name: Prickly Piranha Plant
object.notes: A big purple Piranha Plant with spikes on its body. It can be defeated by jumping on its head.

object.name: Spiny Piranha Plant
object.notes: A big black Piranha Plant with spikes on its head and body. It can only defeated with another object, such as a Stretch Plant or a Rainbow Star.

object.name: Wiggler
object.notes: A small caterpillar-like enemy. (This enemy requires paths to function.)

object.name: Big Wiggler
object.notes: A big version of a Wiggler.

object.name: Haze Area (Cube)
object.notes: A haze effect used in lava-themed galaxies. This object ignores the AreaShapeNo setting.

object.name: Spotlight
object.notes: The spotlight effect used on the starting planet of Boo Moon Galaxy. (This object requires "GhostMazePlanetMask" to function.)

object.name: Hard Controls Area
object.notes: An area that, when entered, makes it harder to control Mario/Luigi.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins: Stone Lift
object.notes: A stone elevator platform used near the end of the first mission of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Ground Pound Block (H-Shape)
object.notes: An H-shaped ground pound block used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Dual-Sided Long Ground Pound Block
object.notes: A long dual-sided ground pound block used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Dual-Sided Medium Ground Pound Block
object.notes: A medium dual-sided ground pound block used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Dual-Sided Small Ground Pound Block
object.notes: A small dual-sided ground pound block used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Mandibug Puzzle (Piece A)
object.notes: A piece of the Mandibug puzzle used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Mandibug Puzzle (Piece B)
object.notes: A piece of the Mandibug puzzle used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Mandibug Puzzle (Piece C)
object.notes: A piece of the Mandibug puzzle used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Clockworld Ruins: Grassy Ground Pound Block
object.notes: A grass-covered ground pound block used in Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Ground Pound Rock
object.notes: A rock that can be ground pounded to drop items.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Ground Pound Block (Square)
object.notes: A square-shaped ground pound block used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Ground Pound Switch
object.notes: A switch that activates something via SW_A when ground pounded.

object.name: Ground Pound Switch (Timer)
object.notes: A switch that activates something via SW_A when ground pounded. The effect is deactivated after the time defined in obj_arg0. (This switch can also be used to create slow-motion effects.)

object.name: Spin-Dig: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Spin-Dig Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Wood Planet
object.notes: The wooden sphere planet used near the end of the first mission of Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Bullet Bill
object.notes: A point that launches bullet-like enemies. "HomingKiller" generates Bullet Bills, "Torpedo" generates Torpedo Teds and "MagnumKiller" generates Banzai Bills. The enemies will be generated periodically. A small bullet named Bill; can be set to home in on the player via obj_arg2 or obj_arg3.

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: The range Mario has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.

field.name: Disable Homing
field.notes: If enabled, the bullets won't home in on Mario.

field.name: Ignore Gravity
field.notes: If enabled, Gravity will be ignored.

field.name: Bullet Count
field.notes: The amount of bullets that can exist at once. Default 1.

field.name: Launch Delay
field.notes: The delay between shots. Default 180.

field.name: Bullet Lifetime
field.notes: The lifespan that bullets will live for before being automatically killed. Default 600.

field.name: Binder Activation delay
field.notes: A delay until this bullet can collide with terrain. Default 35.

object.name: Bee
object.notes: A bee NPC used in forest-themed levels.

object.name: Honeyhop: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Honeyhop Galaxy.

object.name: Queen Bee
object.notes: Her highness, the queen of the bees.

object.name: Queen Bee Planet
object.notes: The planet where the Queen Bee is found. (This planet exists in both games, but the two models are different from each other.)

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Wiggler Planet
object.notes: The planet where two Wigglers and a large H-shaped hole are found; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins: Rotating Platform (Version A)
object.notes: A rotating platform used on the hammer planet in Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins: Rotating Platform (Version B)
object.notes: A rotating platform used on the hammer planet in Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins: Hammer Planet
object.notes: The planet used on the secret Star mission of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Broken Glass Effect
object.notes: A glass-breaking effect used on Launch Stars that require the player to go through glass.

object.name: Shiverburn -- Rock Platforms
object.notes: A set of rocks which rise from lava that are used as a platform on the third planet of Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn -- Skating Planet
object.notes: The third planet in the first mission of Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn -- Skating Planet Ice Layer
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). The ice layer used on the skating planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Li'l Brr
object.notes: An enemy that can damage the player upon contact. Can be stunned with a Spin Attack which reveals its core. The core can be destroyed by most of Mario's actions. A burning rock enemy that floats around and chases after Mario. It will freeze the player upon contact.

field.name: Appearance
field.values: -1 = Wait, 0 = Runaway, 1 = Float
field.notes: Initial nerve state.

field.name: Respawn
field.notes: Keeps respawning after killing if enabled.

object.name: Falling Ice Crystal
object.notes: A falling ice crystal that creates an ice platform that can be stood on.

object.name: Stalagmite
object.notes: A stalagmite that can be destroyed with a Spin Attack

object.name: Cosmic Clone
object.notes: A clone version of Mario that copies the player's movements. (This object crashes the game if used.)

object.name: Cosmic Clone Spawner
object.notes: A spawner that creates Cosmic Clones.

object.name: Invisible Wall 10x10
object.notes: An invisible wall of the size 10 x 10.

object.name: Sky Station -- Disk Planet
object.notes: A disk planet used before the Peewee Piranha boss fight at the end of the first mission of Sky Station Galaxy.

object.name: Switch ? Block
object.notes: A ?-block that triggers a switch after being hit.

object.name: Starship Mario -- Power-Up Display Room
object.notes: The power-up display room used on Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario -- Power-Up Display Room Wall
object.notes: A wall used for the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Chance Cube
object.notes: A dice block that can spawn either ten Coins, a Goomba or a 1-Up Mushroom.

object.name: Spin Drill
object.notes: A drill power-up that allows the player to dig through certain dirt upon spinning.

object.name: Starship Mario -- Power-Up Display Room Door
object.notes: The door that warps the player to the power-up display room on Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario -- Power-Up Display Case
object.notes: A display case for the power-up display room used on Starship Mario.

object.name: Jammyfish
object.notes: A small white jellyfish that can be defeated with a spin attack.

object.name: Jellyfish
object.notes: A big blue jellyfish that causes electrical damage to Mario if he touches it.

object.name: Koopa Shell
object.notes: A Koopa shell; can be carried around, thrown and ridden underwater.

object.name: Boulder Bowl -- Crystal Planet
object.notes: The small orange crystal planet used near the end of the first mission of Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Fearsome Fleet -- Megahammer Planet
object.notes: The planet where Megahammer is fought in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Fearsome Fleet -- Megahammer Planet Platform
object.notes: A long yellow platform that can be destroyed if it is hit by Megahammer.

object.name: Lakitu
object.notes: A Koopa that sits on a cloud and throws Spinys at the player.

object.name: Jump Beamer
object.notes: A robot-like enemy that emits electrical rings. Its head can be used as a spring.

object.name: Swing Pole
object.notes: A pole that can be swung from and jumped off of; used in Deep Dark Galaxy and Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Star Ball Launcher
object.notes: A hole that launches a Star Ball along a path.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Paintbrush Planet Star Ball Launcher
object.notes: The Star Ball launcher used on the second planet of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Disk Planet Star Ball Launcher
object.notes: The Star Ball launcher used on the third planet of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Spoing
object.notes: A fuzzy jumping spider enemy used in a few galaxies, such as Space Junk Galaxy and Tall Trunks Galaxy.

object.name: Ground Pound Spring
object.notes: A spring that bounces the player into the air when Ground Pounding it.

object.name: Ground Pound Spring (Automatic)
object.notes: A blue spring that bounces the player into the air when jumping on it.

object.name: Jack O' Goomba
object.notes: A Goomba with a pumpkin mask on its head; used in ghost-themed galaxies, such as Ghostly Galaxy and Flash Black Galaxy.

object.name: Magikoopa (Fire Balls)
object.notes: A Magikoopa that shoots fire balls. It can be put on a path.

object.name: Magikoopa (Small Goombas)
object.notes: A Magikoopa that shoots small Goombas. It can be put on a path.

object.name: Magikoopa (Li'l Cinders)
object.notes: A Magikoopa that shoots Li'l Cinders. It can be put on a path.

object.name: Crabber (Blue)
object.notes: A blue crab enemy that drops a 1-Up Mushroom if killed.

object.name: Crabber (Red)

object.name: Key

object.name: Small Rock (Kickable)

object.name: Rollodillo

object.name: 1-Up Mushroom (Picture)

object.name: Toad

object.name: Bank Toad

object.name: Mail Toad

The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). The large portal that Bowser disappears through during the intro sequence at Peach's Castle.

The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). object.notes: The position used for the final boss battle in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

object.name: Bowser's Galaxy Generator: Grand Star Planet
object.notes: The planet where Mario/Luigi finds both Princess Peach and the final Grand Star; used in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

object.name: Boomsday Machine
object.notes: The boss fought at the end of Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Cloud Platform
object.notes: A cloud platform used in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla: Castle Gate
object.notes: The large gate used in Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla. (This object requires an SW_A switch to function.)

object.name: Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla.

object.name: Boomsday Machine Planet
object.notes: The planet where the Boomsday Machine is fought in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Boomsday Machine Fan
object.notes: A large metal fan used during the Boomsday Machine battle in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet: Launch Star Platforms
object.notes: The set of platforms where the Launch Star to the Megahammer planet is found. Used in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet: Asteroid Planet
object.notes: An asteroid-like planet seen in the background of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Yellow Moving Platform
object.notes: A thin yellow moving platform used in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet. It requires paths. The following set of parameters is required: - GroupId same as parent's - SW_AWAKE must be equal to parent's SW_A switch - SW_B equal for both objects.

object.name: Yellow Moving Platform Generator Controller
object.notes: This object does additional controling of the platforms from Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet. This object is connected to its parent KoopaJrLv2LiftGenerator object using the GroupId and GeneratorId (l_id of parent) settings. Additionally, this object requires paths.

object.name: Yellow Moving Platform Generator
object.notes: This object controls the generation of platforms from Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet. It requires a unique set of l_id, GroupId, SW_A and SW_B settings, as well as grouped KoopaJrLv2LiftForGenerator and KoopaJrLv2Lift objects. See their descriptions for more information.

object.name: Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet: Starting Platforms
object.notes: The set of platforms used at the start of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet: Checkpoint Platform
object.notes: A single platform used near the checkpoint of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Megahammer
object.notes: The boss fought at the end of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Bowser Jr. Statue
object.notes: A small statue of Bowser Jr. that can be destroyed with a Bullet Bill.

object.name: Bowser's Lava Lair: Wooden Platform
object.notes: A wooden platform where a ground pound switch is found in Bowser's Lava Lair.

object.name: Bowser's Lava Lair: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Bowser's Lava Lair.

object.name: Bowser (Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet)
object.notes: The boss fought at the end of Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

object.name: Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet: Meteors Planet
object.notes: The planet where some meteors and the large Bowser door are found at the end of Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

object.name: Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet: Moving Platform
object.notes: A moving wooden platform used near the end of Bowser's Gravity Gauntet.

object.name: Bowser (Bowser's Galaxy Generator)

object.name: Bowser's Galaxy Generator: Stone Seesaw Platform

object.name: Bowser (NPC)

object.name: Bowser Battle Door (Red)
object.notes: The large red door found at the end of Bowser galaxies; leads to the Bowser battle.

object.name: Bowser Battle Door (Purple)
object.notes: A locked purple door found in the middle of Bowser's Lava Lair; used for a tutorial on how to ground pound meteors.

object.name: Airship
object.notes: A standard airship.

object.name: Airship Manhole Cover
object.notes: A manhole cover found on certain airships.

object.name: Bowser Statue
object.notes: A statue of Bowser that can be destroyed with a Bullet Bill.

object.name: Bowser Statue (Laser)
object.notes: A statue of Bowser that fires a laser. Used in Bowser's Lava Lair.

object.name: Bowser's Star Reactor: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in both Bowser's Star Reactor (SMG1) and Bowser's Lava Lair (SMG2).

object.name: Flipbug
object.notes: A small big-like enemy that attacks Bee Mario (Bee Luigi), and runs away from Mario/Luigi.

object.name: Goomba
object.notes: The iconic "kuribo" enemy used in every Mario game since 1985. Also commonly known as a 'Goomba'.

object.name: Big Goomba
object.notes: A big Goomba that requires two spin attacks to defeat.

object.name: Fluffy Bluff: Goomba Fence
object.notes: A fence used on the Goomba cage in The Chimp's challenge in Fluffy Buff Galaxy.

object.name: Small Goomba

object.name: Bowser's Galaxy Generator: Lava Platform
object.notes: A stationary lava platform used in the Magmarrgh section near the end of Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

object.name: Bowser's Galaxy Generator: Fortress Carpet Platform
object.notes: A small fortress-like platform with a green carpet used in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

object.notes: The planet with water used in Bowser's Galaxy Gauntlet.

object.notes: A purple platform that sinks when Mario/Luigi steps onto it; used in Melty Molten Galaxy. (This platform is green in SMG2; used in Shiverburn Galaxy.)

object.notes: A blue platform that sinks when Mario/Luigi steps onto it; used in Melty Molten Galaxy. (This platform is slightly smaller in SMG2.)

object.notes: The planet where Mario/Luigi must use a fluff flower to glide past lava shooters in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

object.name: Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet: Starting Planet

object.notes: A fire ball with a tail; used in lava-themed galaxies.

object.name: Lava Sparks Effect (Small)

object.notes: A dark gray sinking platform used on the Yoshi planet in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

object.name: Bowser's Galaxy Generator: Yoshi Planet
object.notes: The planet where Yoshi is found in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

object.name: Starshine Beach: Leaf Raft

object.name: Flipsville: Gravity-Change Grate
object.notes: A red grate used to flip the direction of gravity in Flipsville Galaxy.

object.name: Lens Flare Area
object.notes: An area that, when entered, causes a lens flare on the camera.

object.name: Yellow Disappearing Platform
object.notes: A yellow tile that disappears after a few seconds and then reappears. (This object can have a path to move.)

object.notes: An area that, when entered, changes the lighting based on the lighting selection in obj_arg0.

object.notes: A large stone rock used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Banzai Bill
object.notes: A point that launches bullet-like enemies. "HomingKiller" generates Bullet Bills, "Torpedo" generates Torpedo Teds and "MagnumKiller" generates Banzai Bills. The enemies will be generated periodically. A larger version of a Bullet Bill.

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: The range Mario has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.

field.name: Disable Homing
field.notes: If enabled, the bullets won't home in on Mario.

field.name: Ignore Gravity
field.notes: If enabled, Gravity will be ignored.

field.name: Bullet Count
field.notes: The amount of bullets that can exist at once. Default 1.

field.name: Launch Delay
field.notes: The delay between shots. Default 180.

field.name: Bullet Lifetime
field.notes: The lifespan that bullets will live for before being automatically killed. Default 600.

field.name: Binder Activation delay
field.notes: A delay until this bullet can collide with terrain. Default 35.

object.name: The Chimp (Skating Challenge)
object.notes: The Chimp used for the skating challenges in both Freezy Flake Galaxy and Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Freezy Flake: Skate Challenge Controller
object.notes: A controller used to control The Chimp's skating challenge in Freezy Flake Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Skate Challenge Controller
object.notes: A controller used to control The Chimp's skating challenge in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Underwater Plant
object.notes: A decorative plant for underwater sections. Must have ShapeModelNo set to 0 to be visible.

object.name: Spawn Point
object.notes: Sets the spawn point for Mario/Luigi at the start of a mission or at Checkpoints in a mission.

object.name: Spawn Point Controller (Grand Star Return Position)
object.notes: A controller that sets the spawn point of Mario/Luigi on Starship Mario after they collect a Grand Star.

The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). The chimney used on Starship Mario.

object.notes: A target for a cannon used on the Hammer Bros. planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Cannon Target (Cloud Ferris Wheel Planet)
object.notes: A target for a cannon used on the cloud ferris wheel planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Cannon Target (Dark Matter Planet)
object.notes: A target for a cannon used on the dark matter planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.notes: An area that, when entered, causes Mario/Luigi to lose his cap.

object.name: Mecha-Koopa
object.notes: A small robotic version of a Koopa that can be defeated by ground pounding it.

object.name: Bowser Cutscene Controller (Prologue)
object.notes: A controller used to trigger the Bowser cutscene in the prologue.

object.name: Lubba
object.notes: The large purple Luma that helps the player throughout their adventure in Super Mario Galaxy 2.

object.name: Flash Black: Mansion Door
object.notes: The door of the mansion used at the start of Flash-Black Galaxy. Use SW_A to close the door.

object.name: Flash Black: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Flash Black Galaxy.

object.name: Flash Black: Silver Star Platforms
object.notes: The planet where the Silver Stars are located in the first mission of Flash Black Galaxy.

object.name: Flash Black: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Flash Black Galaxy.

object.name: Skeeter
object.notes: A purple spider that lunges across water.

object.name: Li'l Cinder
object.notes: An enemy that can damage the player upon contact. Can be stunned with a Spin Attack which reveals its core. The core can be destroyed by most of Mario's actions. A burning rock enemy that floats around and chases after Mario. It will burn the player upon contact. If attacked with a Fire Ball, it gets reignited.

field.name: Appearance
field.values: -1 = Wait, 0 = Runaway, 1 = Float
field.notes: Initial nerve state.

field.name: Respawn
field.notes: Keeps respawning after killing if enabled.

object.name: Mercator Projection Area (Cube)
object.notes: Any object and its paths that are placed inside this area are projected around the origin of the zone. Only a limited amount of objects can be projected, objects that extend the classes MercatorFixParts, MercatorRailMoveParts and MercatorRotateParts are known to work with this. Note that the object OceanSmallTurtle requires mercator projection. This object is useless in SMG2. This object ignores the AreaShapeNo setting.

object.name: Message Area
object.notes: This area is used as a text trigger in various places.

object.name: Goombeetle
object.notes: A Goomba with a helmet on its head.

object.name: Meteor (Gateway)
object.notes: A small meteor used in Gateway Galaxy. This will cause a quake once it hits the floor.

object.name: Meteor
object.notes: A meteor used in several galaxies, including Melty Molten Galaxy (SMG1) and Hightail Falls Galaxy (SMG2).

object.name: Meteor Spawner
object.notes:
A spawn point used for meteors.
Warning: These will crash the game if they hit the ground.

object.name: Space Junk: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Space Junk Galaxy.

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Grass Bonus Planet
object.notes: An optional planet used in the second planet of Yoshi-Star Galaxy.

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Mist Effect (Grass Bonus Planet)
object.notes: A mist-like effect used on the grass bonus planet in Yoshi-Star Galaxy.

object.name: Reflection Area
object.notes: Used for reflection models, but these don't exist in SMG2 anymore. Thus, this object is pretty much useless.

object.name: Whittle
object.notes: A wood NPC who appears in Puzzle Plank Galaxy and Tall Trunk Galaxy.

object.name: Undergrunt
object.notes: A mole enemy with a helmet that moves on a path.

object.name: Pianta
object.notes: A Pianta used in Starshine Beach Galaxy.

object.name: Starshine Beach: Pianta Statue
object.notes: The large Pianta statue used in Starshine Beach Galaxy.

object.name: Starship Mario: Bee Mushroom (Display Room)

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Background Food Objects (Donuts)
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A set of donuts used in the background of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.
