object.name: Squizzard Planet
object.notes: The planet where Squizzard is fought in Slipsand Galaxy.

object.name: Galaxy Fly-In Controller
object.notes:
A controller used to control the fly-in path for each mission. NOTE: Time (Obj_arg0) is input in 100ths of a second. For example, if Obj_arg0 = 300 then the time is 3 seconds.
Camera Amount: In the Camera settings for the Galaxy/Zone, you may find e:Scenario starter:XXX:XXth (but in japanese). This is the Camera for this Scenario starter. (EXAMPLE: e:Scenario starter:001:00th would be for a Scenario starter with a Camera ID of 1) This number is determined by how many XXth's there are. (EXAMPLE: if [e:Scenario starter:001:00th,e:Scenario starter:001:01th,e:Scenario starter:001:02th] were camera's, you would put the number "3" as the value for Camera Amount.)

object.name: Sky Station Star Select Controller (Prologue)
object.notes: An area that, when entered, loads the Star select screen for Sky Station Galaxy. (This object is used in the prologue.)

object.name: The Chimp Challenge: Score Controller
object.notes: A controller used to control the required points needed and the time limit given in The Chimp's challenges; used in challenges received from letters.

object.name: The Chimp (Scoring Challenges)
object.notes: The Chimp used for the scoring challenges, like in Slimy Spring Galaxy.

object.name: Seagulls
object.notes: A group of seagulls used in the background of water-themed galaxies.

object.name: Seagulls (Starship Mario)

object.name: Sentry Beam (Laser)

object.notes: This area controls and sets the distance for shadow dropping.

object.notes: An object that shows shooting stars.

object.name: Signboard

object.name: Short Cutscene

object.name: Cosmic Cove: Star Bunny Planet
object.notes: The planet where the Star Bunny appears; used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.name: Starshine Beach: Water Coral
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A set of coral used in Starshine Beach Galaxy.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.notes: An area that, when entered, plays a sound.

A controller that controls the beat. Used in several galaxies, including Beat Block Galaxy and Flash Black Galaxy.
The beat controls the way some objects behave, such as Beat Blocks.

The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). object.notes: The center part of a splashing effect from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.notes: The main planet used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.name: Cosmic Cove: Waterfall Splashing Effect
object.notes: An unused object that was once used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy. It creates the waterfall effects for the galaxy's main planet. This object is somewhat glitchy and in the final game, the splashes are part of the main model.

object.name: Starship Mario: Star List Sign
object.notes: The sign used to show the Star List on Starship Mario.

object.name: Starbit
object.notes: A small piece of a Star; a snack enjoyed by Lumas everywhere.

field.name: Color
field.values: -1 = Random, 0 = Purple, 1 = Yellow, 2 = Green, 3 = Blue, 4 = Red, 5 = White
field.notes: Color of the Star Bits.

object.name: Starbit Crystal
object.notes: A large blue crystal that releases Star Bits when broken; used on Launch Star paths.

object.name: Starbit Crystal (Small)
object.notes: A small blue crystal that releases four Star Bits when broken; used on the Rock Mushroom route in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Starbit (Moving)
object.notes: This object creates star bits which move on a path.

field.name: Number of Star Bits
field.notes: Amount of Star Bits to be distrbuted along the path or circle.

field.name: Circle radius
field.notes: Radius of the Star Bit circle, only used if a path has not been assigned.

field.name: Star Bit Color
field.values: -1 = Random, 0 = Purple, 1 = Yellow, 2 = Green, 3 = Blue, 4 = Red, 5 = White
field.notes: The color the Star Bits will be.

object.name: Starbit Flower
object.notes: A small flower that releases one Star Bit when touched.

object.name: Starbit (Following)
object.notes: Creates a bunch of star bits, that fly around the player. Should be used on launch star paths.

object.name: Starbit Group
object.notes:
An object that either spawns a circle of starbits around itself or spawns starbits along a path assigned to it. If no path is assigned, the circle behavior will be used, otherwise, the path behavior will be used.
* Uses path_args 1 and 2 ? * Uses point_args 0 and 5 ?

field.name: Number of Star Bits
field.notes: Amount of Star Bits to be distrbuted along the path or circle.

field.name: Circle radius
field.notes: Radius of the Star Bit circle, only used if a path has not been assigned.

field.name: Star Bit Color
field.values: -1 = Random, 0 = Purple, 1 = Yellow, 2 = Green, 3 = Blue, 4 = Red, 5 = White
field.notes: The color the Star Bits will be.

object.name: Starbit Creator
object.notes: A rainbow-colored starbit which creates smaller starbits, when activated via SW_APPEAR. Providing a path is optional

object.name: Starbit Spawn
object.notes: Spawns a lot of star bits when activated.

object.name: Starbit Eruption
object.notes: Creates a bunch of star bits when activated.

object.name: Power Star Return Path
object.notes: A controller used to set the return path of Mario/Luigi after he has collected a Power Star. (This object requires paths to function.)

object.name: Mandibug Stack

object.notes: A purple bug that charges at Mario/Luigi once it spots him.

object.name: Prologue Text Area
object.notes: An area that displays some text.

object.name: Prologue Warp Area
object.notes: An area that warps the player to a certain point.

object.name: Prologue: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of the prologue.

object.name: Peach's Castle: Master Luma Planet
object.notes: The planet where Young Master Luma is located during the prologue.

object.name: Scuttlebug (Hanging)
object.notes: A spider-like enemy that hangs from a web.

object.name: Used Block
object.notes: A brown used block used in several galaxies.

object.name: Used Block (2D)
object.notes: A small used block used in the prologue.

object.name: Starship Mario: Stump Platform
object.notes: A small tree stump platform used for NPCs that appear on Starship Mario.

object.name: Beach Bowl: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Beach Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Tweester
object.notes: Moves on a path. Launches the player into the air once they get in its range. SunakazeKun objects may use two spiky rock obstacles to defend themselves. A small tornado enemy with googly eyes and a small attraction range. Can defend itself with two spiky rocks as well.

field.name: Enable rock obstacles
field.notes: Enables the two spiky rock obstacles.

field.name: Enable white color
field.notes: Starts the "White" color animation if enabled.

object.name: Deep Dark: Ghost Ship
object.notes: The ghost ship where Kamella is fought in Deep Dark Galaxy.

object.name: Sunlight Area (Cube)
object.notes: An unused area that was meant to be used in Haunty Halls Galaxy, along with TeresaRoomGlaringLight. This object is an alternate version of GlaringLightArea. Whenever a Boo enters this area, it will be killed.

object.name: Cosmic Spirit
object.notes: The dark blue Cosmic Spirit that aids the player if they die several consecutive times inside an area of a galaxy.

object.name: Launch Star
object.notes: A large orange star that launches the player from one planet to another.

object.name: Launch Star (Pink)
object.notes: A pink version of the Launch Star which appears after a Hungry Luma is fed. (except for the Hungry Lumas on SMG2's worldmap)

object.notes: The third section of the first planet used in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Flip-Out Starting Planet

object.name: Flip-Out Blue Walls (Middle Section)

A set of blue walls used in the middle section of Flip-Out Galaxy's main planet. This section combined forms a basic slight upwards staircase.
Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

object.name: Flip-Out Red Walls (Middle Section)

A set of red walls used in the middle section of Flip-Out Galaxy's main planet. This section combined forms a basic slight upwards staircase.

object.name: Flip-Out Red Walls (1st Section)
object.notes:
A set of red walls used in the first section of Flip-Out Galaxy's main planet. This section combined forms two upward staircases and two wall-jump parts.
Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

object.name: Flip-Out Red Walls (Starting Planet)
object.notes:
A set of red walls used on the starting planet of Flip-Out Galaxy.
Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

object.name: Spiky Topman Spawner
object.notes: A black hole that periodically spawns more Topman enemies. It will only generate one enemy at a time but it will ensure that the provided number of enemies will be spawned. Defeated enemies will respawn after a while. "BegomanLauncher" generates Spring Topmen, "BegomanBabyLauncher" generates Topmini and "TogeBegomanLauncher" generates Spike Topmen. A spawner for a Spiky Topman. Already existed in SMG1, but was first used in SMG2.

field.name: Activation Delay
field.notes: The delay until the first spawn occurs.

field.name: Number of Topman

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: The range Mario has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.

field.name: Disable Homing

field.name: Bullet Lifetime

field.name: Binder Activation delay

object.name: Chompworks: Uplift Platform
object.notes:
A blue platform that follows the assigned path when an SW_A matching it's SW_B gets activated and stops once it's deactivated. Has hardcoded(?) lava particles that display when rising and falling.
Advanced notes: - This object requires very specific timing to work correctly. Used in combination with a HipDropTimerSwitch (or another object that behaves like it), this object requires that the TimerSwitch object triggering it has an obj_arg0 (Time) of EXACTLY the amount of time it takes the platform to complete it's assigned path. - If the TimerSwitch time is longer than the time the platform runs its path, the platform will loop over it's path until the TimerSwitch time ends, which will then stop the platform ANYWHERE it is on the path when it happens, the platform will NOT fall back down or complete the path, it will simply stop where it is, even in the middle of the path. - If the TimerSwitch time is shorter than the time the platform runs its path, it will stop the platform anywhere on the path aswell, interrupting it from completing the path. When the platform is stuck mid-way through the path due to either scenario above, re-activating it will make it snap back to the beginning of the path to begin running through it, so the mid-way stops do not cause desyncs for where it stop between activations. - Requires specific path_args and point_args to work.

object.name: Chompworks: Sinking Platform
object.notes:
A single blue platform that sinks when Mario/Luigi stand on it. Used on the starting planet of Chompworks Galaxy.
[MapPart Arguments] MoveConditionType: Distance - How far it sinks (a negative value to make the object rising up will glitch, turning the object over instead will work) RotateSpeed: Sinking Speed - How fast it sinks RotateAngle: Return Speed - How fast it comes back to it's initial height

object.name: Chompworks: Double Sinking Platform
object.notes:
Two side-by-side blue platforms that sink together when Mario/Luigi stand on them. Used on the starting planet of Chompworks Galaxy.
[MapPart Arguments] MoveConditionType: Distance - How far it sinks (a negative value to make the object rising up will glitch, turning the object over instead will work) RotateSpeed: Sinking Speed - How fast it sinks RotateAngle: Return Speed - How fast it comes back to it's initial height

object.name: Chompworks: Narrow Sinking Platform
object.notes:
A narrow blue and green platform that sinks when Mario/Luigi stand on it. Used on the Golden Chomp planet in Chompworks Galaxy.
[MapPart Arguments] MoveConditionType: Distance - How far it sinks (a negative value to make the object rising up will glitch, turning the object over instead will work) RotateSpeed: Sinking Speed - How fast it sinks RotateAngle: Return Speed - How fast it comes back to it's initial height

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Small Spherical Dirt Planet
object.notes: A small spherical dirt planet from Yoshi-Star Galaxy. It features a small decorative fossil.

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Main Planet
object.notes: The main planet from Yoshi-Star Galaxy. It features a huge volcano.

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Mountain Planet
object.notes: A spherical planet with a huge mountain on it. A similar planet can be found in Good Egg Galaxy from SMG1.

object.name: Haunty Halls: Bulb Berry Planet (Platforms)
object.notes: The solid platforms from Haunty Halls Galaxy's bulb berry section.

object.name: Haunty Halls: Bulb Berry Planet
object.notes: The invisible parts of the bulb berry planet from Haunty Halls Galaxy.

object.name: Yoshi Tongue Explanation Area
object.notes: An area which shows the player how to use Yoshi's tongue.

object.name: Yoshi Egg
object.notes: An egg that hatches into Yoshi if destroyed.

object.name: Magic Cage
object.notes: A magical cage created by a Magikoopa. It holds the Yoshi Egg in Yoshi-Star Galaxy.

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Stone Platform
object.notes: A small stone platform where the player finds the Yoshi Egg in Yoshi-Star Galaxy.

object.name: Pink Fruit
object.notes: A pink fruit which can be eatean by Yoshi. It releases a star bit. If Yoshi eats ten of these fruits, the player will be granted a 1-Up.

object.name: Orange Fruit
object.notes: An orange fruit which can be eaten by Yoshi. It releases a bunch of star bits.

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Moving Wood Platform
object.notes: A moving wood platform from Yoshi-Star Galaxy.

object.name: Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet: Semi-final Planet
object.notes: A set of platforms which make up the semi-final planet before the boss fight.

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Bridge-Pulling Planet
object.notes: A planet where Yoshi has to pull a set of bridges with his tongue.

object.name: Waving Yoshi Area
object.notes: When the player dismounts Yoshi in this area, he waves Mario goodbye.

object.name: Sorbetti
object.notes: The rolling snow ball boss from Freezy Flake Galaxy.

object.name: Freezy Flake: Sorbetti Battle Planet
object.notes: The planet where Mario/Luigi fights Sorbetti from Freezy Flake Galaxy.

object.name: Snow Spike
object.notes: A destroyable snow spike seen during the boss fight in Freezy Flake Galaxy. It keeps respawning.

object.name: Freezy Flake: Sorbetti Planet
object.notes: Sorbetti in form of a planet from Freezy Flake Galaxy.

object.name: Leafless Tree
object.notes: A leafless snowy tree as seen on Sorbetti's planet from Freezy Flake Galaxy.

object.name: Zero Gravity Controller (Cube)
object.notes: A cube of zero gravity.

object.name: Zero Gravity Controller (Cylinder)
object.notes: A cylinder of zero gravity.

object.name: Slipsand: 2D Underground Planet
object.notes: The 2D underground section from Slipsand Galaxy.

object.name: Slipsand: 2D Underground Rotating Stone
object.notes: A rotating stone from the 2D underground section in Slipsand Galaxy.

object.name: Zero Gravity Controller (Sphere)
object.notes: A sphere of zero gravity.

object.name: Cloudy Court: Crushing Wall A
object.notes: A crushing wall from Cloudy Court Galaxy.

object.name: Cloudy Court: Crushing Wall B
object.notes: Another crushing wall from Cloudy Court Galaxy.
